provisions.title: Section 2
Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Subject to the provisions of subsection (3) of section 8 of the Act, no
person shall be registered as a dentist unless he holds-
      ( a ) a degree in dental surgery fiom a recognized university or
            recognized college; or
      ( 6 ) any other qualification in dental surgery considered by the
            Council to be of at least equivalent standard as that specified in
            paragraph ( 4 ; or
      (c) has passed the examination refexred to in regulation 4.
                                   THE DENTAL REGUUTIONS, 1974

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4.-41) Where the Council is in doubt as to the standard ofqualifica-
          tion or skill of an applicant for registration, it 'shall refer the applica-
          tion together with all relaant documentary evidence (of the courses
          of study undertaken by the applicant, the institution at which such courses
          were undertaken and any examinations taken by the applicant) to the Board
          of Examiners appointed by the Council, in accordance with regulation 13 for
          determination.
                  (2) On examining such application the Board of Examiners m a y
               (a) recommend to the Council that the name of the applicant be
                     entered in the register; or
               (6) conduct an examination in respect of the applicant; or
               (c)   recommend to the Council that the application be refused.
                   (3) Where an applicant fails an examination conducted pursuant to
          sub-paragraph (2) (b) the Board of Examiners may recommend to the
          Council that the applicant should not be allowed to repeat the examination
          unless he has obtained, over a specified period being not greater than one
          year, such supervised experience in clinical dentistry as may be determined
          by the Council.
                 (4) A fee of one thousand dollars shall be paid by the applicant to
          the Registrar in respect of an examination conducted pursuant to sub-
          paragraph (2) (6).

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5 . 4 1) Any person who satisfies the requirements for registration may
 hhlk
 mn.4
          apply to the Council in the form specified as Form A in the Schedule for
          registration as a dentist.
                 (2) Any person who applies for registration as a dentist in
          accordance with paragraph (1) and-
                (a) furnishes such satisfactory references as to character as the
                    Council may require; and
                (b) pays the registration fee of two thousand dollars,
          shall be registered as a dentist and shall, while he is so regstered, be entitled
          to use the title "Registered Dentist*'.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-41) A certificate of registration in the form prescribed as Form
F~   B.   B in the Schedule shall be issued by the Registrar to every person
          registered as a dentist in accordance with regulation 5 or deemed to
          be registered as a dentist pursuant to subsection (3) of section 8 of the
          Act.
                          THE DENTAL RECULAl'TONS, 1974
        (2) Where a certificate of registration issued under paragraph (1)
has been lost or destroyed, the person to whom it was granted may apply to
the Registrar for a duplicate certificate which shall be issued only after the
lapse of one year fiom the date of such application and upon payment by the
applicant of a fee of five hundred dollars, and any duplicate certificate so
issued shall be clearly marked "DUPLICATE.
   6 A . 4 1 ) A registered dentist who practises as a dentist shall apply to the
Council in the form specified as Form A1 in the Schedule, to be issued with a
practising certificate.
         (2) A practising certificate shall be valid for a period of twelve
months from the date of issue.
          (3) A practising certificate shall-
                                                                                    FWUIBI.
      (a) be in the form prescribed as Form B 1 in the Schedule; and
      (b) be issued on payment of a practising fee of five thousand
          dollars.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. The register shall contain in relation to every registered dentist the
particulars specified in Form C of the Schedule.                                    F O ~c.I

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. The Registrar shall publish in the Gazette-
      (a) during the period of twelve months commencing on the 19th day
          of September, 1974, a list of all dentists registered during that
          year;
      (b) and thereafter on or before the last day of February of each year,
          a list of all persons so registered during that year,
including in respect of each dentist the particulars specified in Form C in the
Schedule.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9 . 4 1 ) Any person who desires to practise dentisby in Jamaica for a
                     -
limited period of time and who satisfies the requirements for registration
specified in regulation 3, may apply to the Council in the form specified as
                                                                             FmA
Form A in the Schedule to be temporarily registered as a dentist.
        (2) Any such application shall be accompanied by-
               (i)   a certificate signed on behalf of the hospital or other
                     institution at which the applicant intends to practise
                        ( a ) that the applicant bas been accepted to practise
                              dentishy in that hospital or institution; and
                        (b) the period of time for which be has been accepted;
               (ii)   a registration fee of five hundred dollars unless the
                      Council otherwise directs.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10.-41) The Council may, after considering the application, direct the
Registrar to enter the name, address, and qualification of the applicant in the
register as a temporary registered dentist, subject to such terms and
conditionsas it thinks fit.
        ( 2 ) The Registrar shall cause a note to be made next to the entry in
the register of a temporary registered dentist o f
      (a) the name of the hospital or institution to which the dentist is
            assigned;
      (b) the period for which he is regmered; and
      (c) the date of expiry of such registration.
                          PART n1-Dental Auxiliaries
   1 1 . The following classes of dental auxiliaries are hereby prescribed
pursuant to subsection ( 1 ) of section 10 of the Act-
      ( a ) dental nurses;
      (b) dental hygienists; and
      (c) dental technicians.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12.--(I) Subject to the provisions of subsection ( 2 ) of section 1 1 of the
Act, m, person shall be enrolled as a member of any class of &ntai aruriliary
unless-
      (a) in the case of a dental nurse or a dental hygienist, bb
              (i)     holds an appmpriate certificate of proficiency from t
                                                                          k
                      Demtal Auxiliary Training School; or
               me inclusion o f this page is authorired by L.N. 28120031
                   THE DENTAL REGULATIONS. 1974
            (ii) holds an appropriate certificate of proficiency from an
                 approved training institution; or
           (iii) holds any other qualification in dental nursing or dental
                 hygiene considered by the Council to be of at least
                 equivalent standard as those specified in (i) and (ii); or
           (iv) has passed the examination referred to in regulation
                14; or
     (b) in the case of a dental technician he-
            (i) holds a certificate or diploma in dental technology from
                an approved training institution; or
            (ii) holds any other qualification in dental technology con-
                 sidered by the Council to be of at least equivalent
                 standard as that specified in (i); or
           (iii) satisfies the requirements for registration as a dentist
                 but is not so registered or has been registered as a
                 dentist but whose name has been removed from the
                 register; or
           (iv) has passed the examination referred to in regulation 14.
       (2) Any person enrolled by virtue of paragraph (iii) of sub-
paragraph (b) of paragraph (1) shall cease to be so enrolled and his
name shall be removed from the roll if-
    (a) he is subsequently registered as a dentist: or
     (b) in the case of a person whose name had been removed from
         the register, his name is restored to the register.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. For the purpose of regulations 4 and 14, the Council shall appoint
from among its members a Board of Examiners consisting of five
members (one of whom shall be the Director of the Dental Auxiliary
Training School), so. however, that where any member of the Board
              [The hclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 102/20011
                             THE DENTAL REGULATIONS, 1974
          of Examiners so appointed is not available for holding an examination.
          the Council may appoint any registered dentist or enrolled dental
          auxiliary to act in the place of that member.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-(1) Where the Council is in doubt as to the standard of qualifica-
          tion or skill of an applicant for enrolment, it shall refer the application
           and all relevant documentary evidence of the training of the applicant
          to the Board of Examiners for determination.
                                                                                        3
                 (2) On examining such application the Board of Examiners
          may-
              (a) recommend that the applicant be enrolled; or
              (b) conduct an examination in respect of the applicant; or
              (c) recommend that the application be refused.
                 (3) A fee of five hundred dollars shall be paid in respect of any
          examination to be conducted pursuant to sub-paragraph (b) of paragraph
          (2).

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15.-41) Any person who satisfies the requirements prescribed in
          regulation 12 for enrolment as a member of any class of dental auxiliary
Form D.   may apply to the Comcil in the form specified as Form D in the
           Schedule for enrolment as a member of that class of dental auxiliary.
                  (2) Any person who applies for enrolment as a member of any
          class of dental auxiliary in accordance with paragraph (1) and-
              (a) furnishes such satisfactory references as to character as the
                  Council may require; and
                (b) pays the enrolment fee of seven hundred and fifty dollars.
                                                                                        7
                                                                                        .-
          shall be enrolled as a member of that class of dental auxiliary and
          shall, while he is so enrolled be entitled to use one of the titles,
          "Enrolled Dental Nurse" or "EnroTled Dental Hygienist" or "Enrolkd
           Dental Technician" as may be relevant to the class of dental auxiliary
          in respect of which he is enrolled.
                         m e inclusion of thh page b authorized by L.N. 102/2001]
                    T Y E DENTAL REGULATIONS. 1974                                        9
   1 6 . 4 1 ) The certificate of enrolment to be issued by the Registrar
to every person enrolled as a dental auxiliary pursuant to subsection
(3) of section 11 of the Act shall be in the form set out as Form E          FormE
 in the Schedule.
       (2) Where a certificate of enrolment issued under paragraph (1)
has been lost or destroyed, the person to whom it was granted may
apply to the Registrar for a duplicate certificate which shall be issued
only after the lapse of one year from the date of such application
and upon payment by the applicant of a fee of five hundred dollars,
and any duplicate certificate so issued shall be clearly marked
 "DUPLICATE".

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. The roll of dental auxiliaries shall contain in relation to every
enrolled member, the particulars specified in the form set out as
Form F in the Schedule.                                                 F      O    F.~

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18. The Registrar shall publish in the Gazette-
     (a) during the period of twelve months commencing on the 19th
         day of September. 1974, a list of all enrolled members of
         each class of dental auxiliary; and thereafter
     (b) on ar bedine the last day of Febrtmary of each year, a list
        of all persons so enrolled during that year.
hcluding in respect at each dental auxiliary the particulars specified
in Form F in the Schedule.
   1 9 . 4 1 ) Any person who desires to work in Jamaica for a limited
period as a dental auxiliary and who satisfies the requirement for
enrolment as a member of any class of dental auxiliary specified in
regulation 13, may apply to the Council in the form specified as
 Form D in the Schedule to be temporarily enrolled as a member of            p-D.
 that class of dental auxiliary.
               [The inclusion of this page in autr:orlcd by L.N. 102/2001]
                   THE DENTAL REGULATIONS, 1974
       (2) Any such application shall be accompanied by-
     (i) a certificate signed on behalf of the hospital or other institu-
         tion to which the applicant intends to be attached, stating-
              (a) that the applicant has been accepted to work in that
                   hospital or other institution; and
               (b) the period of time for which he has been engaged;
     (ii) a registration fee of three hundred dollars, unless the Council
          otherwise directs.                                                3
  2 0 . 4 1 ) The Council may, after considering the application. direct
the Registrar to enter the name, address and qualification of the
zpplicant in the roll as a temporarily enrolled member of any class
of dental auxiliary, subject to such terms and conditions as the
Council thinks fit.
       (2) The Registrar shall cause a note to be made next to the
entry in the roll in relation to any person temporarily enrolled as
a member of a prescribed class of dental auxiliary, of-
    (a) the name of the hospital or institution to which the dental
        auxiliary is assigned;
    (b) the period for which he is enrolled; and
    (c) the date of the expiry of such enrolment.

provisions.title: Section 21
provisions.content:
21. The functions of the prescribed classes of enrolled dental
auxiliaries shall be as follows-
       (1) An enrolled dental nurse may carry out the following
treatments-
    (a) extracting under local anaesthesia deciduous teeth and roots
        not covered by tissue;
    (b) simple and compound restorations of primary and permanent
        teeth;
             [The inclurion of this page is authon-ed by L.N. 102/200lI
                   THE DENTAL REGULATIONS. 1974
    :c) cleaning and polishing teeth;
    (6) scaling teeth (that is to say the removal of tartar deposits,
          accretions and stains from the surfaces of teeth which are
          exposed or are directly beneath the free margins of the
          gums, including the application of medicaments appropriate
          thereto);
    (e) the application to the teeth of such prophylactic preparation
         as the Council may from time to time determine; including
         fissure sealants and topical fluorides;
    (f)   carry out routine examinations and charting of dental con-
          ditions;
    (g) dispensing of such specific non-prescription   drugs as the
          Council may from time to time determine; including aspirin
          and aspirin combinations or other drugs of similar pharma-
          cological action;
    (h) the administration, whenever indicated, of conduction and
        infiltration anaesthesia to control pain;
    (i) the taking of diagnostic dental radiographs;
    (8 giving advice on matters related to oral hygiene,
so, however. that such treatments shall be carried out only in the course
of his duties in the Government health service and only under the
direction and supervision of a registered dentist or subject to such
conditions as the Council may from time to time determine.
        (2) An enrolled dental hygienist may carry out dental work
ot the fnllowing kind-
    (a) cleaning and polishing of teeth and fillings;
    ( h ) scaling teeth (that is to say. the removal of tartar deposits,
          accretions and stains from the surface of the teeth which
          are exposed or are directly beneath the free margin of the
          gums, including the application of medicaments appropriate
          thereto);
               [The inclusion of thh page is authorized by L.N. 102/20011
                    THE D E N T A L REGULATIONS, 1974
    (c) the application to the teeth of prophylactic preparation as the
          Council may from time to time determine;
    (4 giving advice on matters related to oral hygiene;
    (e) the taking of diagnostic radiographs; and
    (f) performing such reversible dental procedures in the oral cavity
          as may be directed by a registered dentist,
so, however, that such work shall be carried out only under the direction
of a registered dentist who has examined the patient and has indicated
to the dental hygienist the treatment to be carried out; and where
such treatment is being carried out other than during the course of
his duties in Government health service then only under the personal
supervision of a registered dentist present at the time when such
treatment is being carried out.
        (3) An enrolled dental technician shall carry out dental work
of the fo!lowing kind-
    (a) the casting of models from impression of a patient's mouth;
    (b) the construction of appliances based on these models from the
          dentist's prescription;
    (c) repairs of broken or impaired plastic or metallic appliances
         for cases which do not require any procedure in the mouth
        on the part of the dental technician;
    (4 the treatment cf metals and of the plastic materials used in
          the construction of these appliances;
    (e) the construction of splints used in facio-maxillary surgery;
    (f) the construction of orthodontic appliances in accordance with
          the prescriptioris of a registered dentist; and
    (g)   the construction of special appliances such as obturators and
           special prostheses.
                  THi5 DENTAL REGULATIONS, 1974

provisions.title: Section 22
provisions.content:
22. An enrolled member shall carry out only such functions as
may properly be carried out by members of the class of dental
auxiliary of which he is enrolled and an enrolled or registered member
shall not engage in activities contrary to the ethics of &is particular
profession or conduct himself in a manner derogatory to the accepted
standards thereof.

provisions.title: Section 23
provisions.content:
23. An enrolled or registered member shall not act as locum tenens
for or assist any unenrolled or unregistered person in the treatment of
any patient.

provisions.title: Section 24
provisions.content:
24. An enrolled or registered member shall not perform his duties
while he is by reason of the influence of alcohol or drugs, unlikely
to be able to do so efficiently.

provisions.title: Section 25
provisions.content:
25. Where in any disciplinary proceedings an enrolled or registered
member is found guilty of having acted contrary to the provisions of
regulation 22. 23 or 24 he shall be regarded as b e i i guilty of un-
professional misconduct.
                  PARTN-Dixiplinory            Proceedings
   %.-(I) Where an allegation is made to the Council that any re-
gistered or enrolled member (in this Part referred to as "the respon-
dent'') has been convicted of a criminal offence or is guilty of profes-
sional misconduct, the Council shall appoint an investigation committee
to decide whether the case should proceed to htaring, and any investiga-
tion committee so appointed shall investigate the allegation as they
think fit, and shall report thereon to the Comcil, stating whether or
not the allegation made against the respondent has been substantiated.
       (2) Where an investigation committee report to the Council
that a prima facie case has been made out against the respondent in
any case in respect of which that committee was appointed, other
than one involving conviction for a criminal offence, the Council shall
forthwith appoint a disciplinary committee to deal with the matter.
        (3) Any investigation committee or disciplinary committee
appointed in accordance with paragraph (1) or (2). as the case may be,
shall consist of the chairman and four other members of the Council
at least one of whom shall not be a registered dentist, so, however,
that no member of an investigation committee (except the chairman
of the Council) shall be appointed to be a member of the disciplinary
committee in respect of the same case.
                  iachuion of tbL p.so L authorized by L.N. 4/197q
                   THE DENTAL REGULATIONS, 1974
       (4) A quorum of the investigation committee and the disciplin-
ary committee, respectively. shall be three.

provisions.title: Section 27
provisions.content:
27.-41) An investigation committee appointed in accordance with
the provisions of regulation 26 may, in relation to any case in respect
of which they are appointed, at any stage of the investigation. take
advice from any attorney-at-law appointed by the Council, and may
obtain proof of evidence in support of the allegations made against
the respondent, and may, in such cases as they think fit, decline to
proceed with the investigation unless the evidence in support of the
allegations (other than evidence of a conviction) is verified by statutory
declaration.
        (2) Where it is proved by the certificate of the competent
officer of the court in which the proceedings took place, that the
respondent has been convicted of a criminal offence and that such
conviction has not been subsequently quashed on appeal and that
there is no pending appeal against that conviction, the investigation
committee shall so inform the Council and the Council may forthwith
and without further inquiry, direct the Registrar to remove the name
of the respondent from the register or roll as the case may be.
        (3) In any other case in respect of which it is appointed, the
investigation committee shall invite the respondent to furnish any
written statement of explanation which he may wish to submit and
shall consider such statement of explanation before taking a decision
on the matter.

provisions.title: Section 28
provisions.content:
28.--(I) Where a disciplinary committee is appointed in accordance
with the provisions of regulation 26, they shall iix a date for hearing
the matter and may dlrect the attomy-at-law appointed by the
Council to take all necessary steps for verifying the evidence to be
submitted to them and for obtaining the necessary documents and
attendance of witnesses at the hearing.
        (2) The disciplinary committee shall send to the respondent
a notice in writing, specifying the nature and particulars of the
allegation against him, and informing him of the time and place of
the meeting of the disciplinary committee at which the matter will
be heard.
       (3) A notice under paragraph (2) shall be sent to the respon-
dent by registered post to his address entered in the register, or if
the Registrar has reason to believe that that address is not his present
                   ~ d a dn Ibi. pys i~a.tkriadd by L.N. 4/197q
                   THE DENTAL REGULATIONS, 1974
address, then to any other address which may be known to the Regis-
trar, and shall be posted so as to allow at least twenty-eight days to
elapse between the date of posting and the date fixed for hearing.
       (4) Where there is a complaint in any matter fixed for hearing
before the disciplinary committee, the Registrar shall send him a copy
of the notice sent to the respondent under paragraph (2).
        (5) Any party to proceedings being held under the provisions
of this regulation may be represented at the hearing by an attorney-at-
law or other person, so, however, that if any such party intends to
be so represented at the hearing, he shall give not less than seven
days' notice of that intention to the Registrar.

provisions.title: Section 29
provisions.content:
29.41) At the hearing of any matter the attorney-at-law. Registrar,
or other person appointed by the Council for that purpose, shall state
to the disciplinary committee the allegation against the respondent,
the facts of the case, and submit evidence in support of the' allegation.
and the respondent or his representative shall be entitled to cross-
examine any witness appearing in support of the allegation against
him.
        (2) At the conclusion of the statement of the allegation against
the respondent and the evidence in support thereof and the cross-
examination of the relevant witnesses, the respondent or his repre-
sentative shall be invited by the chairman to address the disciplinary
committee and to tender evidence in answer to the charge, and the
attorney-at-law, Registrar, or other person appointed by the Council
for that purpose shall be entitled to cross-examine the respondent
or any witness giving evidence on his behalf, and to reply upon the
whole case after the respondent or his representative has replied.

provisions.title: Section 30
provisions.content:
30. If the respondent does not attend either personally or by a repre-
sentative the disciplinary committee may prweed to hear and deter-
mine the case in his aksence.

provisions.title: Section 31
provisions.content:
31.41) Upon the conclusion of the case, the disciplinary committee
shall, after consideration of ad the relevant evidence, report their
findings forthwith to the Council in writing.
        (2) The Council shall, as soon as may be practicable after
the receipt of a report from a disciplinary committee, consider such
report and make its decision thereon.
               lLhe hcluriaa of chi, m e h nllthnrized by L.N. 4119761
                  THE DENTAL REGULATIONS, 1974
        (3) The Registrar shall, immediately after the pronouncement
by the Council of its findings in any matter, inform the respondent
by registered letter of the decision of the Council, and shall after
twenty-eight days from the date of posting such letter, or where there
is an appeal from the decision of the Council at the conclusion of
such appeal, remove the name of the respondent from the register or roll,
as the case may be, if directed so to do by the Council or carry out any
other decision of the Council as may be appropriate in any particular
case, and make a note beside the entry in the register or roll as the
case may require relating to the respondent of the decision of the
Council.

provisions.title: Section 32
provisions.content:
32.--(I) Any appeal to the Tribunal pursuant to section 15 of the
Act shall be commenced by notice in writing addressed to the Tribunal,
and such notice shall be lodged with the chairman of the Tribunal
and a copy delivered to tbe Registrar within twenty-one days from
the date of the decision appealed against.
       (2) Every such notice of appeal shall include-
    (a) the name and address of the appellant;
    (6) particulars of the decision of the Council gain st which the
         appeal is being made;
    (c) the grounds of appeal; and
    (d) copies of all relevant correspondence and documents.
         (3) Notwithstanding anything hereinbefore contained, the Tri-
bunal may hear and determine any appeal lodged after the time limit
herein provided, if in all the circumstanoes of the case they think
it just and proper so to do.

provisions.title: Section 33
provisions.content:
33. All expenses incurred by the respondent in disciplinary proceed-
ings brought against him or by any person appealing to the TribmaI
from any decision of the Council shall be borne by the respondent
or person appealing, as the case may be.
           PARTV-Restoration of Name to ~ G i s t e or
                                                    r Roll

provisions.title: Section 34
provisions.content:
34.-41) Where the name of any registered or enrolled member has
been removed from the register or roll in accordance with section 13
of the Act, any application for the restoration to the register or roll
of the name of that member shall be made in writing addressed to
the Council and signed by the applicant stating the grounds on which
the application is made.
                   T H E DENTAL REGULATIONS. 1974
        (2) The application shall contain the names and addresses of
at least three persons able and willing to identify the applicant and
to give evidence as to his conduct and character since the removal
of his name from the register or roll, and such other evidence as the
Council may require.
        (3) Not less than two of the persons mentioned in paragraph
(2) shall belong to one or more of the following categories-
     (a) registered dentists;
     (b) enrolled dental auxiliaries;
     (c) registered medical practitioners;
     (d) Justices of the Peace;
     (e) ministers of religion.
        (4) The Council may require the applicant to verify by statutory
declaration any statement made in his application, or any further
staterneat WW      it may tbhk necawmy, and may. if it thinks fit.
require the applicant to attend in person at a meeting of the disciplinary
committee at which the matter is to be considered.

provisions.title: Section 35
provisions.content:
35. If upon consideration of the application and of the evidence
furnished in s u m thereof, the disciplinary committee is satisfied
that the name of the applicant should be restored to the regiskr or
roll, they shall advise the Council accordingly and the Council may
then direct the Registrar to restore the name of the applicant to the
register or roll, as the case may require.

       (I) The Registrar must be notified of any subsequent change of address.
        (2) Recent graduates must request the Dean of their institution to write
            directly to the Council to assure the Council that the applicant is a
            bona fide graduate.
        (3) All other applicants must request their current registering body to
            *rite directly to the Council, stating the applicant is a dentist in good
            atanding. This requirement need not be met by those seeking temporary
            registration.
        (4) Examination fee :      $100               Registration/ Application           fee:       f2OO
